main event: A witness observed a silver elliptical object traveling southerly at a speed faster than a jet on 23 July 1955.
interesting points: The object was described as being the size of a nickel., The sighting lasted between ten to fifteen seconds., The observation was made during daylight., The object was evaluated as possibly being a balloon or an aircraft but insufficient data prevented a definitive conclusion., The witness was a 23-year-old piano teacher from Sherman Oaks, California.
